result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Kadeem Klepps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentence and extended supervision now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means, with the victim H.H.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with any unmet needs or remaining programming after completion of prior extended supervision.  

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Kadeem Klepps

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: didn't give defendant DNA form.  Defendant is in prison.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Count 2, dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Repeater allegation confirmed by Attorney Bosben.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of disorderly conduct as a repeater, contrary to 947.01(1) and 939.62(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for:  1 year probation, consecutive to sentence and ES of sentence now serving.  Comply with any unmet needs after completion of prior extended supervision.  No contact with H.H.  Anger mangement, if agent recommends.  AODA, and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  

Court ordered:  1 year probation, consecutive to sentence and extended supervision of sentence now serving.  Comply with any unmet needs or remaining programming after completion of prior extended supervision.  No contact with the victim, H.H.   Subject to random testing by his agent. Seek and maintain employment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
